# Project: Investigate a Dataset (No_show) ## Table of Contents
  • Introduction
  • Data Wrangling
  • Exploratory Data Analysis
  • Conclusions

# Introduction:

### firstly the project is to investegate the No_show data by cleaning the data,  make the analsys, and answering the quistions.

> **Quistion1**: what is the gender that have the highest percentage of no show?

> **Quistion2**: does the Age effecting for no_show?

> **Quistion3**: does the scholarship effecting the no_show?

> **Quistion4**: does sms have huge impact on showing?

> **Quistion5**: which illness type have the highest no-show ratio?

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline

source: #### replacing the values of no-show column Yes to 1 and No to 0
### define the yes and no variables to can do the analysis easily.
### Question 1 what is the gender that have the highest percentage of no show?

p2.Gender[pno].hist(alpha=0.5 , label='No');
p2.Gender[pyes].hist(alpha = 0.5 , label='Yes')
plt.title('Gender vs Yes/No Histogram')
plt.legend()

source: ### Question 2 does the Age effecting for no_show or not?
### Question 3 does the scholarship effecting the no_show?
### Question 4 does sms have huge impact on showing?
### Question 5 which illness type have the highest no-show ratio?
#### Freq or bar plot to calculate ratios
#### Freq or bar plot to calculate ratios
#### Freq or bar plot to calculate ratios

## Conclusions I have started with cleaning the date. Then, I have replaced the no_show values yes to 1 and no to 0, Then i have created pyes and pno to do the analsis easier. ### Limitations: there are some limitations in the data but the most important ones: ##### 1) most of the columns are eaither one or zero so that it cant be visualized will. ##### 2) the ScheduledDay and AppointmentDay are not having the same values so that i cant use them in my analysis. ### Answers for the Questions are listed: > **Question1**: approxemitly 22.8% of the femailes didn't come 25.8% of the males didn't come. So the mens have the highest number of no showing. > **Question2**: it seems that the ages from '[10 to 20]' and '[40 to 50]' and '[80 to 90]' has the highest no-show ratio. > **Question3**: total of 82000 without scholarship and 20000 of them didnt come (24.4%), total of 11000 with scholarship and 2000 of them didnt come (18.1%) which means that the scholarship didn't change the rate of no-show > **Question4**: total of 35000 who received an sms and 10000 of them didnt come (28.6%), total of 76000 who didnt received an sms and 13000 of them didnt come (17.1%) which gives that receiving sms doesnt make much influnce in the results of no-show. > **Question5**: it seems that diabetes have the highest ratio.
